snippet: Doctors who perform drug-induced abortions in Missouri will have to be in the room to administer the initial dose, according to a new law set to take effect next month.
abstract: Missouri law requires that doctors who perform drug-induced abortions will have to be in room to administer initial dose and will not be allowed to do it remotely via teleconferencing; Gov Jay Nixon says he decided not to veto measure but also that he will not sign it.
lead_paragraph: Doctors who perform drug-induced abortions in Missouri will have to be in the room to administer the initial dose, according to a new law set to take effect next month.
